New Records: Marlins snapped Phillies' six-game winning streak with a 9-5 victory
Connor Norby homered and drove in three runs
Jonah Bride homered to lead off the fifth inning
Xavier Edwards and Nick Fortes had two hits each
Phillies' Kyle Schwarber hit a tying sacrifice fly for his 93rd RBI of the season
Key Match Events: Marlins scored three runs in the seventh inning against Taijuan Walker, including a solo homer by LÃ³pez and a fielder's choice RBI by Sanoja
Phillies starter Aaron Nola allowed five runs and nine hits over 4 2/3 innings
Pre-Game Insights: Marlins added four new players to the roster, including Javier Sanoja making his major league debut
Marlins manager Skip Schumaker highlighted the team's improved performance after a tough loss the previous day
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson criticized Nola's command and said the team needed to regroup
Marlins players and manager praised the team's resilience and effort
Javier Sanoja reflected on his debut, focusing on being aggressive despite not getting his first hit
Miscellaneous Highlights: John McMillon pitched 1 1/3 scoreless innings of relief for the win
Phillies selected the contract of catcher Aramis Garcia and designated RHP Nick Nelson for assignment
Marlins transferred LHP Andrew Nardi to the 60-day injured list
Phillies have not announced a starter for the series finale but mentioned RHP Edward Cabrera as a potential option
